speaker: Gestral kid
line: Wow, the village looks so cool!!

speaker: Gustave
line: Is this your first time here?

speaker: Gestral kid
line: First time this life! I got revived at the Sacred River not too long ago. I’m only 3,7 hours old!

speaker: Gustave
line: That’s interesting… Thank you, little one.

speaker: Gestral kid
line: Time to train! You should train too.

speaker: Gestral kid
line: (whisper)

speaker: Gestral kid
line: I’m serious, you really need to train. Gotta train hard and get back to my old physique! Then I can go fight!

speaker: Gustave
line: Your old physique? To fight?

speaker: Gestral kid
line: Yeah, see, in my last life, I was allll muscle! But now I’m only 3,8 hours old, and I have to build myself up all over again, so I can prove myself in the arena!

speaker: Gustave
line: (What is he talking about?)

speaker: Gestral kid
line: Ok, time to go train. Like Golgra, time spent yapping is time you could have spent TRAINING. Wish me luck!

speaker: Gestral
line: Welcome to the Gestral Village. Expeditioners, eh? You’re a fun looking bunch. Unless you try to cause problems. Then we’ll beat you up. Which will be fun for me, but not for you.

speaker: Gustave
line: Noted.

speaker: Gestral
line: Me? I’m a nice brush. Doesn’t mean I wouldn’t go for a nice little brawl with you.

speaker: Gustave
line: (It’s going to be like this everywhere, huh.)

speaker: Lune
line: It’s… it’s really a village of Gestrals!

speaker: Gustave
line: They seem better at surviving than humans.

speaker: Maelle
line: I guess intelligence is not a prerequisite for survival on the continent. Now to find the chief’s house. Probably the biggest one.

speaker: Gestral warrior
line: You may come in.

speaker: Golgra
line: So YOU’RE the warriors who demolished our ULTIMATE Sakapatate?

speaker: Maelle
line: It wasn’t that strong.

speaker: Golgra
line: Hmmmm. I see. Well. You’ve earned my respect. What can I do for you?

speaker: Lune
line: Are you the “Chef?”

speaker: Golgra
line: I am indeed the “Chef” of our village. The name’s Golgra.

speaker: Lune
line: There are so many questions I’d love to ask–

speaker: Gustave
line: We need to get to the Paintress. Noco said you could help us cross the sea?

speaker: Golgra
line: Humans. Still so obsessed with the Paintress.

speaker: Lune
line: Others have passed through here?

speaker: Golgra
line: A few of your expeditions, every few years. Hard to keep track. Hmmm. Do you not have your own boat? How did you get here in the first place?

speaker: Lune
line: A white-haired man destroyed it.

speaker: Golgra
line: And you survived? My respect.

speaker: Lune
line: You know him?

speaker: Golgra
line: He attacked the village once. Some of us survived. Somehow. Mmm. Ok. You have no boat. In that case, your best bet is Esquie. If you ask nicely, maybe Esquie can take you across the water.

speaker: Lune
line: So Esquie exists!

speaker: Golgra
line: Of course! Esquie lives not far from here. But only the greatest warriors are allowed through. You need a password.

speaker: Maelle
line: Why?

speaker: Golgra
line: Esquie is very friendly, but Esquie could also accidentally eat you. Esquie doesn’t know its own strength sometimes. It would be irresponsible to let weaklings visit Esquie.

speaker: Maelle
line: We already defeated your Ultimate Sakapatate.

speaker: Golgra
line: Not. Good. Enough. You’ll have to enter our Legendary Tournament to get the password. This is the Gestral way. You will be fighting our Legendary Warriors. They are old so it should be easy.

speaker: Lune
line: What is this tournament?

speaker: Golgra
line: Now I’m excited. Let’s see what you can do. Oh, and you’ll also fight the Stranger. Yeah, that will be fun.

speaker: Lune
line: The Stranger?

speaker: Golgra
line: Okay, enough talk. Go fight now. Do you want to go to the arena directly or do you want to beat up a few gestrals around here first?

speaker: Lune
line: We’ll… look around first.

speaker: Golgra
line: Very well. The Arena is on the other side of the village when you’re ready.

speaker: Noco
line: You guys are so slow; I went on many other adventures and still I beat you here!

speaker: Gestral
line: When I was little, I swore I’d enter the arena as soon as I turned thirty. My birthday was yesterday… And I’m so nervous I’ve started pulling all my bristles out. I’m too young to lose my bristles!! You’ve got lovely bristles too, so you must understand my pain!

speaker: Lune
line: Uh, yes, I sure do.

speaker: Gestral
line: I can’t fight BALD! Although… Mandsol was bald and he’s the greatest champion of all time. Hmmm… that gives me an idea…

speaker: Tall Gestral
line: You’re on your way to the Sakapatate factory? I hope they choose me as a test weapon!

speaker: Lune
line: You sound way too eager about getting beaten up.

speaker: Tall Gestral
line: Oh yes, pain is life.

speaker: Lune
line: Good for you…

speaker: Gestral kid
line: TASTE MY WRATH! BRUSH KICK!

speaker: Gestral kid 1
line: They’re building new Sakapatates! Can’t wait to see what they come up with!

speaker: Gestral kid 2
line: Yeah! I heard the new ones have laser cannons!

speaker: Gestral kid 3
line: And a Void Sword! Can you imagine?

speaker: Lune
line: That’s great, but could they make sure these Sakapatates only attack Nevrons?

speaker: Gestral kid 2
line: No! It should attack Gestrals too so we can fight it!

speaker: Gestral kid 1
line: Oh, good idea! Let’s tell them that!

speaker: Gestral kid 3
line: FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT!

speaker: Lune
line: It’s a wonder Gestrals have survived this long…

speaker: Olivierso
line: Expeditioners who haven’t died yet! Incredible. You might have what it takes to triumph over the MOST dangerous of Nevrons.

speaker: Lune
line: We’ve fought plenty of dangerous Nevrons already.

speaker: Olivierso
line: Ha! But have you fought the CHROMATIC Nevrons? They have terrible strength and a powerful aura. They’ve wiped out entire expeditions on their own. So naturally, we wanted to fight them too. But many Gestrals have gotten squashed. If you too yearn for glorious battles, then seek out these Chromatic Nevrons! Hunt them all!

speaker: Olivierso
line: Now go! Make your people proud for the day you return to Lumière!

speaker: Jujubree
line: Isn’t this stuff amazing!

speaker: Gestral
line: No! It’s useless!

speaker: Jujubree
line: At first, it’s amazing. Then it’s useless!

speaker: Gestral
line: Alright, have a good day!

speaker: Jujubree
line: Pleasure doing business with you! I think a beatdown is in order. Oh, hello, good humans, how do you do? enjoying the Gestral Bazaar?

speaker: Lune
line: Eer, it’s okay.

speaker: Jujubree
line: Great: I’m glad our… eagerness for battle hasn’t scared you away.

speaker: Lune
line: Why? Are you desperate for clients?

speaker: Jujubree
line: Oh, no, no, no! I have plenty of clients, they’re just… dead! Haha. Anyway! I have some useful items for you!

speaker: Lune
line: For us?

speaker: Jujubree
line: Yes! Whether it’s weapons or Pictos. I cater to your every need! My name is Jujubree, and I proudly announce that… The Expedition Shop is back in business! I got DESTROYED. Heheh, I have stuff you might want to buy! I hope you like what you see.

speaker: narrator
line: After getting the weird looking Pictos

speaker: Jujubree
line: What a weird looking Pictos you have here. Could you show it to me for a second?

speaker: Lune
line: (You hand the Weird Pictos to Jujubree)

speaker: Jujubree
line: You see, I found a similar Pictos not too long ago. Let me see if– Ha-HA! I think it’s complete now! No need to thank me, hehe.

speaker: Gestral
line: Bah, I wanna get stuff, but I’ve got nothing to trade…

speaker: Lune
line: What’s the currency here?

speaker: Gestral
line: It’s a barter system, bud, no currency. You can trade Chroma though.

speaker: Lune
line: Oh? But what use do you have for Chroma?

speaker: Gestral
line: We make Chroma offerings at the Sacred River. Part of the rebirth process. Because we, Gestrals, can resurrect at the Sacred River. You guys knew that, right?

speaker: Gestral
line: My old patate says I’m too small a patate to fight Nevrons.

speaker: Lune
line: You are too young to fight Nevrons.

speaker: Gestral
line: BWAAAAAAAAAAH!

speaker: Lune
line: Are you alright?

speaker: Gestral merchant
line: I just traded all of my junk to get this. “Professor Champ de Cuivre’s chromatic legumes.” These are miracle vegetable seeds from the city of Lumière.

speaker: Lune
line: (“From Lumière”, huh? A classic swindler’s trick.)

speaker: Gestral merchant
line: With these, I’ll become rich, and finally own the Bazar… They’ll see.

speaker: Lune
line: (Poor guy.)

speaker: Berrami
line: Lumièrans! Too bad Moshi’s in hibernation, Moshi loved Expeditioners. Knew more than anyone else about them. I got Moshi’s notes somewhere, if you’re interested. “… incredible writing and relics of a mysterious group of beings. I believe they are the ones Verso referred to as Lumièrans! They are not a myth! Though my Searching days are long past, I am grateful to all the new Searchers who helped this old Gestral add to this marvellous and DEFINITIVE collection of Lumièran writings – Moshi the Searcher, Year 43.”

speaker: Lune
line: Fascinating.

speaker: Berrami
line: I want to reassemble the book for Ol’ Moshi. You lot have been travelling around, yeah? You seen any of these writings?

speaker: Lune
line: Actually …

speaker: Lune
line: (show Expedition journals)

speaker: Berrami
line: FA-BU-LOUS! Let me copy these. If you find more, save me a copy, will ya?

speaker: Lune
line: Oh, but I’m not sure we’ll be back anytime soon.

speaker: Berrami
line: Don’t worry. I’ll wait. If you find more journals, save me a copy, will ya? Give me 5 more, and I’ll reward ya greatly.

speaker: Gestral merchant
line: Back off my junk. I won’t sell you nuthin’.

speaker: Lune
line: What do you mean, will you or won’t you sell me something?

speaker: Gestral merchant
line: Means I’m callin’ the guards on ya.

speaker: Lune
line: Got it, backing off right now.

speaker: Gestral
line: I want to trade your stuff for my stuff.

speaker: Gestral merchant
line: Your stuff is worthless.

speaker: Gestral
line: You’re worthless.

speaker: Gestral merchant
line: Wanna fight?

speaker: Gestral
line: No, I’ll just stay here and look at your stuff.

speaker: Gestral merchant
line: Okay, cool. Business is boomin’.

speaker: Shady Gestral
line: My shop is in the back alley. Want me to show you the good stuff, adventurers?

speaker: Lune
line: (Cliché, but okay.)

speaker: Eesda
line: Give us all of your belongings. They’re ours now.

speaker: Lune
line: A shakedown? You don’t know how to pick your marks, do you?

speaker: Shady Gestral
line: Oh, we know. Our marks are the people with fat pockets.

speaker: Lune
line: Heh, wrong. Looks like we’re about to give you guys a lesson.

speaker: Shady Gestral
line: OWW, THAT HURTS!!

speaker: Eesda
line: Okay, we’re sorry!! Just for you, we’ll trade the things we have!! You can even pay with Chroma! Spare us, please!

speaker: Lune
line: (Hey, pretty convenient.)

speaker: Eesda
line: Please, take a look at our stuff, strong one…

speaker: Gestral worker
line: Hey, Expeditioners! Wanna help build the next model of Sakapatate?

speaker: Lune
line: Really?

speaker: Gestral worker
line: I was obviously joking. This task is way too complicated for pea-brained humans.

speaker: Lune
line: Pea-brained? What do they teach you in school?

speaker: Gestral worker
line: Skool? I don’t know what that is, but it sounds cool.

speaker: Gestral worker
line: I need to do it faster, eheheheh.

speaker: Lune
line: What are you building?

speaker: Gestral worker
line: Heheheheheh!!

speaker: Lune
line: Okay, I guess.

speaker: Gestral
line: You guys comin’ to see the joust games? It’s the newest trend in town. Nothing beats a good old fight to the death in the arena though.

speaker: Gestral
line: My hope is that one of these days, everybody’s troubles will be resolved through jousting. I mean, fighting is so dépassé.

speaker: Lune
line: I think I’ll stick with the old method for now.

speaker: Gestral
line: So you guys up for some jousting?

speaker: Lune
line: Err, not really, no.

speaker: Gestral
line: That’s too bad. When we want a break from fighting, we joust. Best game there is.

speaker: Lune
line: Jousting is still a form of fighting though.

speaker: Gestral
line: Not everyone knows that, don’t ruin the fun for them! My kiddo prefers jousting to fighting… So if he ever knows that it’s just fighting with more rules, he’s gonna have a meltdown.

speaker: Gestral
line: Welcome to the most boringest neighbourhood in the whole Village. The Infirmary. I mean, who wants to heal their cuts?? Keep your scars like a real Gestral to remind you of the beauty of battle!

speaker: Lune
line: A bit too gloomy for me, thanks.

speaker: Gestral kid
line: We’ve got a lot of injured right now. The Nevrons attacked not too long ago. I’d rather die than come back to the village injured. Looks beyoooond boring, sleeping all day up there.

speaker: Gestral doctor
line: I don’t feel like healing people today.

speaker: Lune
line: Guess they will all die then.

speaker: Gestral doctor
line: Yeah, it’s no big deal.

speaker: Lune
line: You’re the worst doctor. And why are you so big?

speaker: Gestral doctor
line: I ate a lot of Nevrons.

speaker: Lune
line: You eat Nevrons??

speaker: Gestral doctor
line: I’m kidding. I was born with this terrible sickness that makes my bones grow every day. Every day, I feel the excruciating pain of my bones pushing the boundaries of my flesh. Every day, I wish I was not born to suffer like this. So one day, I decided I don’t want anyone to suffer the way I do. I studied very hard, harder than anyone else to become a doctor. Even if there is no competition here because everyone is dumb. I pushed myself through self-discipline. And I saved more than ten thousand of my fellow Gestrals. All the while, suffering inside like no one else in the world. So don’t tell me what I am. Don’t tell me who you are. Because the most horrible thing you’ve gone through in your life, I go through every day.

speaker: Lune
line: Ok… Sorry…

speaker: Gestral kid 1
line: We finally got him cornered.

speaker: Gestral kid 2
line: He’s gonna pay this time.

speaker: Strong-looking Gestral
line: W-what? What did I d-do?

speaker: Gestral kid 1
line: Give me back my Gestral hero figurine!!

speaker: Gestral kid 2
line: Yeah, you filthy thief! Give it back.

speaker: Strong-looking Gestral
line: Noo! I didn’t do anythinggg!

speaker: Lune
line: (I hope this doesn’t escalate for this poor guy.)

speaker: Gestral
line: I didn’t want him to be mad, I was only joking. But now, it’s too late to back down. So I’ll stand my ground, and pretend to be mad.

speaker: Gestral
line: What, you wanna argue with me too? So everybody wants me to go, is that it?!

speaker: Gestral warrior 1
line: WE’RE TRAINING–

speaker: Gestral warrior 2
line: TRAINING–

speaker: Gestral warrior 1
line: WE STAY FOCUSED–

speaker: Gestral warrior 2
line: FOCUSED–

speaker: Gestral warrior 1
line: TO MATCH UP WITH THE BEST–

speaker: Gestral warrior 2
line: THE BEST–

speaker: Gestral warrior 1
line: WE DO IT FOR GOLGRA–

speaker: Gestral warrior 2
line: FOR GOLGRAAA!

speaker: Gestral warrior
line: Make way for the next Gestral hero.

speaker: Lune
line: No.

speaker: Gestral warrior
line: You think you’re tough wood, huh??

speaker: Lune
line: Yes.

speaker: Gestral warrior
line: Well, I’m tougher. And woodier. I’ll tear you in two.

speaker: Gestral warrior
line: (fight)

speaker: Gestral warrior
line: O-Okay. I’m just a little twig on your pathway, don’t mind me. Huuu–

speaker: Gestral
line: I came to see Matthieu the Colossus! I hope he’s coming! Though rumour is, he’s a mere bristle of his former self.

speaker: Gestral Arena fan 1
line: HEY, “DOMINIQUE GIANT FEET” GANG HERE.

speaker: Gestral Arena fan 2
line: WE’RE FAN OF “BERTRAND BIG HANDS”, PATATE.

speaker: Gestral Arena fan 1
line: DON’T CALL ME PATATE. DOMINIQUE HAS BIGGER FEET THAN THAT BRUSH’S HANDS.

speaker: Gestral Arena fan 2
line: WHAT DO YOU MEAN, BERTRAND’S HANDS ARE SO BIG HE COULD GRAB THE PAINTRESS AND POWER BOMB HER FROM THE STRATOSPHERE.

speaker: Gestral kid
line: I’m a “JulienTiny Head” fan.

speaker: Strong-looking Gestral
line: Hey, humans. I suggest you turn back. This place is not for the faint of heart.

speaker: Lune
line: Why, what’s happening here?

speaker: Strong-looking Gestral
line: You know how we Gestrals love a good fight?

speaker: Lune
line: That’s an understatement.

speaker: Strong-looking Gestral
line: Heh, yeah, that’s right! See, this here’s where we come when we wanna go full brush-mode, you got me? It’s the designated “no-rule” zone, so… you’ve been warned.

speaker: Gestral warrior 1
line: Come on and fight, you prick!

speaker: Gestral warrior 2
line: No, you approach, stinkard!

speaker: Gestral elder
line: Hello.

speaker: Gestral marchand
line: Hello.

speaker: Gestral elder
line: Do you want to trade some cards, my good sir?

speaker: Gestral marchand
line: Yes. In a most discreet but respectful manner, I hope.

speaker: Gestral elder
line: Indubitably.

speaker: Gestral
line: Over there is the…

speaker: Gestral
line: (gag)

speaker: Gestral
line: Ugh… you don’t wanna go there.

speaker: Lune
line: Why? What’s there?

speaker: Gestral
line: The daft old geezer’s building a casino. Gambling and stuff. No fighting allowed. Games are cool, but no fighting? What kind of ridiculous nonsense is that? Makes me sick. Don’t worry. I’m not gonna puke, like, right now. Maybe later, though.

speaker: Gestral
line: I built all this alone. I am classy, I am elegant, and yet they treat me like a monster.

speaker: Lune
line: That’s impressive, you’re quite the hard worker.

speaker: Gestral
line: They will never understand. One day, this place will be full of casinos and everyone will listen to jazz.

speaker: Lune
line: I hope we’ll be alive to see it happen.

speaker: Gestral gambler
line: Hey, Expeditioners! Do you like gambling?

speaker: Lune
line: Yes.

speaker: Gestral gambler
line: I knew it. I saw it in your eyes. If you’re really the gambling-type, you should be able to answer this correctly. Let’s say that every time that I hit, I have a 50% chance of dealing 100% more damage. What are my chances of dealing more damage in the long run?

speaker: Lune
line: I don’t care.

speaker: Gestral gambler
line: CORRECT! It doesn’t matter ‘cause it just makes things more thrilling. A true gambler at heart. Here, take this as a sign of our eternal friendship. May your battles bring you lots of excitement.

speaker: Gestral warrior
line: What did I get a house with a view of the stupid theatre? I want to be a REAL Gestral hero, not a pretend one like those brush heads running around their stage.

speaker: Lune
line: What’s a Gestral hero?

speaker: Gestral warrior
line: Ahhh, a Gestral hero is an absolute battle GENIUS whose combat prowess is so dominant, they can single-handedly protect the entire village against the foulest of Nevrons!

speaker: Alexcyclo
line: Stylé.

speaker: Lune
line: Huh?

speaker: Alexcyclo
line: What I mean to say is, “What a fashionable ensemble!” I have some stylish pieces for sale, very

speaker: Alexcyclo
line: à la mode

speaker: Alexcyclo
line: ! Come, take a peek. Stay chic.

speaker: Gestral
line: Let’s dance.

speaker: Gestral
line: I don’t know which Gestral invented theatre, but they were a visionary!

speaker: Lune
line: Isn’t it just a smaller arena?

speaker: Gestral
line: … You’re a visionary.

speaker: Gestral merchant
line: In the palm of your hand I can read… A life of fighting.

speaker: Gestral kid
line: YEEEEAAAAAAAHHHHHHH!

speaker: Gestral worker
line: This is a sacred place.

speaker: Lune
line: We saw this door before.

speaker: Gestral worker
line: Pfft, of course you have. These doors are all over the continent.

speaker: Lune
line: What’s with the huge manor inside?

speaker: Gestral worker
line: Whaaat? You’ve been INSIDE??

speaker: Lune
line: Oh, so you’ve never been teleported to the ominous, perfectly maintained manor?

speaker: Gestral worker
line: It’s never opened before. At least, not for us Gestrals. Wowww.

speaker: Gestral
line: The guy next door says he is a philosopher, but I am the real philosopher.

speaker: Lune
line: Really? Show me some philosophy then.

speaker: Gestral
line: When the sun rises, the plants bloom.

speaker: Lune
line: That’s it?

speaker: Gestral
line: Buy my books.

speaker: Lune
line: No, thanks.

speaker: Gestral
line: Get lost.

speaker: Gestral
line: Welcome to my lovely house.

speaker: Lune
line: Your house is quite empty.

speaker: Gestral
line: Aren’t we all empty once we learn how meaningless our lives are?

speaker: Lune
line: Huh?

speaker: Gestral
line: I am a philosopher. I hope you buy my books someday.

speaker: Gestral
line: The Paintress… She will get us all…

speaker: Lune
line: I thought Gestrals were not affected by her power?

speaker: Gestral
line: Oh, I know. I’m trying to speak your language. Another human group came here some time before and that’s what they told me.

speaker: Lune
line: Another Expedition?

speaker: Gestral
line: Yeah, same ridiculous uniform.

speaker: Lune
line: You remember their number? Their name?

speaker: Gestral
line: No, they get beat up and left pretty fast.

speaker: Victorifo
line: Hmmmm– HMM?? I was having a nice little nap on my stairs. You better not have woken me up just so you could steal in my house. Owowow, okay, okay. You beat me, alright? Now, please, leave, I want to be alone.

speaker: Golgra
line: Go to the arena and show me your strength, Expeditioners. Do you want to go to the arena directly, or do you want to beat up a few Gestrals around here first?

speaker: Lune
line: Take us to the arena.

speaker: Golgra
line: That’s the Gestral spirit.

speaker: Lune
line: Lead the way. Guess we have to enter the tournament now.

speaker: Gestral warrior
line: The tournament has begun. Find Limonsol if you want to sign up. You can find him over there.

speaker: Limonsol
line: You wanna register for the tournament? You’re talking to the right Gestral. So far, we’ve got sign-ups for three of our legendary champions. And… a mysterious new warrior. Did I mention the prize is a powerful weapon? So how ‘bout this?

speaker: Maelle
line: Count us in.

speaker: Limonsol
line: Oho, I appreciated the enthusiasm. Unfortunately, in the arena, it’s one-on-one fights only. No worries though. I’ll sign you up as a team. Just decide before each fight who gets the honour of getting beat up.

speaker: Maelle
line: Got it.

speaker: Limonsol
line: Alright, you’re all signed up! Your opponent is one of our legendary champions. Berttrand Big Hands!! Who’s gonna go fight? Gustave/Lune/Maelle it is. I hope you are ready!

speaker: Limonsol
line: You won! Wow. Next time won’t be so easy, I’m sure. Your opponent is one of our legendary champions. Dominique Giant Feet!! Who’s gonna go fight? Gustave/Lune/Maelle it is. I hope you are ready!

speaker: Limonsol
line: You won! Wow. Next time won’t be so easy, I’m sure. Your opponent is one of our legendary champions. Matthieu the Colossus!!! Who’s gonna go fight? Gustave/Lune/Maelle it is. I hope you are ready!

speaker: Limonsol
line: You won! Wow. Next time won’t be so easy, I’m sure. You’ll be fighting against the mysterious new warrior. I hope you’re prepared otherwise the prize will go to them! Gustave/Lune/Maelle it is. Good luck!

speaker: Gestral announcer
line: And NOW! The man who single-handedly destroyed a Sakapatate.

speaker: Maelle
line: Wait– That’s–

speaker: Gustave
line: Sciel?

speaker: Sciel
line: What– How– You guys– You’re alive! I thought I was the only one left– I knew you were resourceful.

speaker: Lune
line: How did you get here?

speaker: Gestral announcer
line: Hey, humans! We’re here to see some fighting! If you don’t wanna fight, we’ll come down and fight ourselves!

speaker: Sciel
line: They’re expecting a bit of a show. Shall we?

speaker: Maelle
line: Well, that wasn’t so bad.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, really just felt like beating old people.

speaker: Maelle
line: So it wasn’t so bad.

speaker: Sciel
line: Am I one of those old people?

speaker: Gustave
line: One day, I hope. Hey, how’d you end up here?

speaker: Sciel
line: Oh, um. After the beach– I ended up in an odd yellow forest, not too far from here. Had to dodge a few Nevrons. But luckily, I met a Gestral who guided me here. What about you?

speaker: Gustave
line: Um… Well, I– I woke up near to a waterfall and–

speaker: Lune
line: We can talk later. Let’s go back to Golgra.

speaker: Gustave
line: No time to lose.

speaker: Golgra
line: You return as champions. Well done, well done. Ok then, you ready? The password is– “Get outta my way.”

speaker: Maelle
line: The password is “get outta my way?”

speaker: Sciel
line: Very gestral-ish.

speaker: Golgra
line: Esquie’s Nest is east of the Village. Sunniso guards the path. Shout the password as loud as you can and Sunniso will let you through.

speaker: Sciel
line: “As loud as we can.” Got it.

speaker: Gustave
line: Thank you. For everything.

speaker: Golgra
line: Try not to die too soon.

speaker: Maelle
line: Gestral positivity is so heart-warming.

speaker: Golgra
line: One more thing. We’ve opened the back door for you. It’ll be easier to come back and visit us.

speaker: Sciel
line: Thanks, Chief.

speaker: Sciel
line: I still can’t believe it. I lost hope after a while, but you all survived.

speaker: Gustave
line: What was your plan if we hadn’t? Be a gestral champion until your Gommage?

speaker: Sciel
line: Well, it was a lot of fun so, yeah, maybe?

speaker: Lune
line: Noco’s quite obsessed with your arm. Your apprentices will be extremely proud knowing a Gestral loves their work.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, they’d be insanely excited.

speaker: Lune
line: Well, they did a great job designing your arm. It was quite a creative assignement you gave them.

speaker: Gustave
line: Well, when life gives you lemons…

speaker: Lune
line: Losing an arm is quite a lemon.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, it’s not limonade.

speaker: Lune
line: (laughs)

speaker: Gustave
line: … Maybe you should stay…

speaker: Maelle
line: What?

speaker: Gustave
line: It’s safer in the village.

speaker: Maelle
line: And miss the chance to meet Esquie? No way!

speaker: Gustave
line: Maelle…

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m ok. We stick together.

speaker: Gustave
line: You okay? You’ve been quiet since we left the Village.

speaker: Sciel
line: Yeah. Sorry… Bad memories.

speaker: Gustave
line: Wanna talk about it?

speaker: Sciel
line: Hm, no.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hm, nah…

speaker: Sciel
line: I’m glad you’re here.

speaker: Gustave
line: I would never abandon a member of Aquafarm 3.

speaker: Sciel
line: Aquafarm 3. That was so long ago. You and Sophie were inseparable on that project.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, we were.

speaker: Sciel
line: It was a good project. It fed so many neighbourhoods at once. Kinda nostalgic, thinking back. We really thought we were making a difference.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hey, we’re still making a différence.

speaker: Sciel
line: Yes. Of course!

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah…

speaker: narrator
line: Gustave finds a spot where he can be alone. He spends some time writing in his journal. He writes about Gestrals, he knows how happy his apprentices will be to learn that they exist. He hopes that one day, his apprentices will read everything he wrote.

speaker: Gustave
line: For those who come after.

speaker: Sciel
line: I can’t believe it. We’re gonna meet THE Esquie.

speaker: Lune
line: The Gestrals. And Esquie. The tales are true.

speaker: Maelle
line: Do you feel someth– White hair… Who are you?

speaker: White-haired man
line: Alicia. I told you to stay home. It’s not good for you to see this. Yes. Yes, I understand. It’s her fault and she doesn’t even know it. But you can’t be here.

speaker: Maelle
line: What are you talking about? What’s my fault?! What is this?!

speaker: White-haired man
line: You should never have come. You’re only going to make things worse. For everyone. Now take your friends and go home. Let them spend their final year in peace. This is your only warning.

speaker: Sciel
line: I can’t wait to see–

speaker: Gustave
line: Maelle? Hey, hey, hey…

speaker: Maelle
line: It was him! It was him! The white-haired man– and this woman–

speaker: Gustave
line: Wai– Where– What are you talking about?

speaker: Lune
line: Maelle, breathe. Slow down. What did you see? Think carefully. Every detail could be important.

speaker: Maelle
line: He said– He said we need to go… home. And that it’s– It’s my fault? That I’m– I’m gonna make things… worse. For everyone. You were all– frozen. I couldn’t– I couldn’t– It was like– a waking nightmare.

speaker: Gustave
line: It’s ok, it’s ok, it’s over.

speaker: Lune
line: What else? You said there was a woman?

speaker: Sciel
line: Lune, maybe later.

speaker: Maelle
line: She– She had a mask– And–

speaker: Lune
line: I know this is hard, but I need you to focus, okay? While the details are fresh.

speaker: Gustave
line: Lune. Ask her tomorrow. Hey, hey. Breathe. Silent to me. You’re safe. Do you understand? Okay? It’s over.

speaker: Gustave
line: Feeling better?

speaker: Maelle
line: Yeah–

speaker: Lune
line: We can debrief along the way. Let’s head east to Esquie’s Nest.
